bibl.note: This is a letter dated June 1, 1838 from Sarah Moore to her cousin Henry King. She offers him news of the family as well as the status of their health. Moore also expresses concern over Henry King's daily routine and safety.

div1.p:
We recieved your letter on the 25 whitch was truley graifying to us all as we ware very anxeous to hear from you Albert & William I was very glad to hear you have the fatiegue so well Dear Cousin I hope you will keep a good resolution as that is the mane thing in a Soldier I often think about you & wish I could see you dear Cousin I hope it will be an advantage to you Henry I wont you to recollect the advice your Mother gave you sitin on her bed side as it is her wish for you to do well & also William & Albert as she has a feelin for you all tel William I saw his Bros john Jay before yesterday his Fathers family was all well John Thomas & Lady has bin up to see us all Henry your Aunt Sally Gannaway has bin very sick but is recoverin again & your Brother apears lost without you yet I and lookes every evening for you he apears to look to your Mother for perfection your sweet little sister can sit alone and gnaw a piece of bread they have named her Sarah Elizabeth Charles after says budey Henry is goin to kill him one indian your Father is at Franklin at this time tending to the racles but will be home to day we are all well at this time and I hope this may find you and all Capt Yocum company in good health tel Mr Snell
his Father has bin very sick but is getin better Cous Henry I am anxousley watin for the time for you to come home as I do miss you so mutch of a night your Mother says she wonts you to act the parte of a Sodier & when you return home let it be in prase not like the Davidson Company the looked so bad they did not make any hault in Murfreesboro but went direct on I wont you to write to me & let me no whot you are goin to do or whene you have to go we hearde that one of your Solder got kild accidentley Henry I wont William & Albert to be careful in handlin your gunes Cous mary Cous Elizabeth and martha send thare love to yo your Gran Mothers & Aunt Jane & familys are all well your Mother Brother & Sisters joines me in love to you William & Albert may the god of Heaven shower down his blessings on you all do write to me as you promised your Mother will write to you soon
div1.closer: Your sinsere Cousin Sarah W Moore the Negroes all send howdy to you excuse bad writin
